alert.note: Alert for Hampden; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 12 at 1:55PM EDT until July 13 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Hampshire and Franklin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Northampton. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding affects a large portion of the Oxbow in Northampton. Flood waters also reach Route 5, a portion of which may be impassable. Flooding spreads across the lower lying sections of Hadley. In Hatfield, back water from the Connecticut River will push the Mill River over its banks, flooding parts of Valley Street and surrounding areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 115.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 112.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM EDT Wednesday was 115.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 110.3 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 112.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 114.9 feet on 07/02/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EDT.
